<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_resume_connection:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN void
MHD_resume_connection (struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  struct MHD_Daemon *daemon = connection->daemon;
#if defined(MHD_USE_THREADS)
  mhd_assert (NULL == daemon->worker_pool);
#endif /* MHD_USE_THREADS */

  if (0 == (daemon->options & MHD_TEST_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME))
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("Cannot resume connections without enabling " \
                  "MHD_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME!\n"));
#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  MHD_mutex_lock_chk_ (&daemon->cleanup_connection_mutex);
#endif
  connection->resuming = true;
  daemon->resuming = true;
#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  MHD_mutex_unlock_chk_ (&daemon->cleanup_connection_mutex);
#endif
  if ( (MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_ (daemon->itc)) &&
       (! MHD_itc_activate_ (daemon->itc, "r")) )
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Failed to signal resume via inter-thread " \
                 "communication channel.\n"));
#endif
  }
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
MHD_itc_activate_ (daemon->itc, "r")
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the presented fragment: MHD_resume_connection calls MHD_itc_activate_ (a different function). Rule 17.2 would be violated only if MHD_itc_activate_ directly or indirectly called MHD_resume_connection (creating recursion). There is no evidence of such a call in the provided code; to be certain, inspect the implementation or call graph of MHD_itc_activate_ for any path back to MHD_resume_connection.
